From: Financial Services ISAC

Subject: CYV4: Apache MINA Information Disclosure Vulnerability [FS-ISAC Green]

  FS-ISAC     Cyber Vulnerability  
FS-ISAC Green: Recipients may share TLP GREEN information with peers, trusted government and critical infrastructure partner organizations, and service providers with whom they have a contractual relationship, who have a need-to-know but not via publicly accessible channels.
Title:
Apache MINA Information Disclosure Vulnerability
Tracking ID:
947023
Reported Date/Time (UTC):
15 Apr 2019 04:00:00 UTC
Risk:
4
Audience:
Analysts, Basic Members, Core Members, FSISAC Customer Service, MSP Members, Premier Members, Standard Members
Special Handling:
Secunia
Handling Instructions:

For more information on Flexera Software, please visit www.flexerasoftware.com/svm
Summary:
A vulnerability has been reported in Apache MINA, which can be exploited by malicious people to disclose sensitive information.


Secunia CVSS Scores: Base: 4.3 Overall: 3.8 (CVSS:3.0/AV:A/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:N/E:U/RL:O/RC:C)
Business Impact:
Exposure of sensitive information
Severity:
2 - Minimal Impact (Normal)
Urgency:
2 - Action Recommended
Credibility:
5-Verified
Vendor(s):
Apache Foundation
Product(s):
Description:
CVE References:

CVE-2019-0231
2019-04-15: At the time of this advisory, a description was not available.


Details:

1) An error when handling close_notify SSL/TLS messages can be exploited to send otherwise encrypted messages in plaintext and subsequently disclose certain data.

The vulnerability is reported in versions prior to 2.0.21.


Affected Products:

Apache MINA 2.x
Corrective Action:
Update to version 2.0.21.
Source(s):
Original Advisory:
:

Advisory ID:
SA88455
CVE #:
CVE-2019-0231
BUGTRAQ ID:
Change History:
2019-04-15: Initial release
